newsitem.title: UK: UK's NFU puts 1996 wheat harvest at 15.78 mln T.
newsitem.headline: UK's NFU puts 1996 wheat harvest at 15.78 mln T.

text.p: The National Farmers Union (NFU) estimated the 1996 UK wheat harvest at 15.78 million tonnes and barley at 7.68 million, with the total grain crop up 10 percent from last year.
The NFU figures compare with last year's 14.31 million tonnes of wheat and 6.83 million tonnes of barley.
The NFU forecast the total grain harvest at 24.09 million tonnes, up from last year's 21.86 million with oats and other cereals put at 650,000 tonnes from last year's 720,000 tonnes.
In recent years NFU estimates have generally been close to the final results of the Ministry of Agriculture production survey. Provisional data from the survey are expected in mid-October.
NFU said the overall wheat area planted for 1996 harvest had expanded to 1.96 million hectares representing an increase of 5.64 percent on the previous year.
